parts.text:
{
  "translation": "(1) Amatsupo (Doishiyumi): Setting up a \"trick bow.\"\n(2) Swords. These are different from the swords used in war; they are usually hung above the treasures piled up on the right side of the house. They are not used in times of war, but they are used during uniwente, etc.",
  "title": "Footnote Translation",
  "comment": "Translated the Japanese footnotes, maintaining the original meaning and using simple English.",
  "agent": "TranslationAgent_JA_to_EN",
  "text_type": "FOOTNOTE"
}

translation_result_ja_to_en.translation:
(1) Amatsupo (Doishiyumi): Setting up a "trick bow."
(2) Swords. These are different from the swords used in war; they are usually hung above the treasures piled up on the right side of the house. They are not used in times of war, but they are used during uniwente, etc.
translation_result_ja_to_en.title: Footnote Translation
translation_result_ja_to_en.comment: Translated the Japanese footnotes, maintaining the original meaning and using simple English.

parts.text:
{
  "translation": "(1) アマツポ(弩いしゆみ)，即是設置「機關弓」。\n(2) 刀劍。這與戰爭時使用的刀劍不同，平時吊在家中右側，堆放寶物的地方。戰爭時不會使用，但在uniwente等儀式時會使用。",
  "title": "註釋翻譯",
  "comment": "將日文註釋翻譯成繁體中文，保留了原文含義，並使用現代中文。",
  "agent": "TranslationAgent_JA_to_ZH",
  "text_type": "FOOTNOTE"
}

translation_result_ja_to_zh.translation:
(1) アマツポ(弩いしゆみ)，即是設置「機關弓」。
(2) 刀劍。這與戰爭時使用的刀劍不同，平時吊在家中右側，堆放寶物的地方。戰爭時不會使用，但在uniwente等儀式時會使用。
translation_result_ja_to_zh.title: 註釋翻譯
translation_result_ja_to_zh.comment: 將日文註釋翻譯成繁體中文，保留了原文含義，並使用現代中文。

parts.text:
{
  "translation": "(1) Amatsupo (crossbow): This refers to setting up a \"trick bow.\"\n(2) Swords: These are different from the swords used in war. Normally, they are hung on the right side of the house, above the pile of treasures. They are not used in war, but they are used in ceremonies such as uniwente.",
  "title": "Footnote Translation",
  "comment": "Translated the Japanese footnotes into English, preserving the original meaning and using modern English.",
  "agent": "TranslationAgent_ZH_to_EN",
  "text_type": "FOOTNOTE"
}

translation_result_zh_to_en.translation:
(1) Amatsupo (crossbow): This refers to setting up a "trick bow."
(2) Swords: These are different from the swords used in war. Normally, they are hung on the right side of the house, above the pile of treasures. They are not used in war, but they are used in ceremonies such as uniwente.
translation_result_zh_to_en.title: Footnote Translation
translation_result_zh_to_en.comment: Translated the Japanese footnotes into English, preserving the original meaning and using modern English.

parts.text:
{
  "translation": "（1）Amatsupo（弩弓）即設置「機關弓」。\n（2）刀劍。這與戰爭時使用的刀劍不同，平時吊掛在家中右側堆積的寶物上方。戰爭時不會使用，但在uniwente等儀式時會使用。",
  "title": "腳註翻譯",
  "comment": "翻譯了日文腳註，保持了原文意思，使用了簡潔的中文。",
  "agent": "TranslationAgent_EN_to_ZH",
  "text_type": "FOOTNOTE"
}

translation_result_en_to_zh.translation:
（1）Amatsupo（弩弓）即設置「機關弓」。
（2）刀劍。這與戰爭時使用的刀劍不同，平時吊掛在家中右側堆積的寶物上方。戰爭時不會使用，但在uniwente等儀式時會使用。
translation_result_en_to_zh.title: 腳註翻譯
translation_result_en_to_zh.comment: 翻譯了日文腳註，保持了原文意思，使用了簡潔的中文。
